abstract.p: New Jersey Transit plans to unseal segment of subway tunnel beneath downtown Newark for new light rail line between Broad Street train station and Elizabeth; photo (S)

block.p: Sealed and forgotten for decades, a segment of subway tunnel beneath downtown Newark will be resurrected for a new light rail line between the Broad Street train station and Elizabeth, officials announced last week. By recycling about 1,000 feet of tunnel beneath Raymond Boulevard, New Jersey Transit said it would save at least $80 million and a year of construction time on the line, which will also serve the New Jersey Performing Arts Center, the Riverfront Baseball Stadium, Pennsylvania Station and Newark International Airport when it opens in 2005. The tunnels, built in the 1930's, once funneled 2,000 streetcars a day from Newark's suburbs to a downtown trolley terminal.
